Flexible Dieting

  • About Flexible Dieting

    What is Flexible Dieting?

    Flexible Dieting(or commonly known as 'If It Fits Your Macros') is simply the tracking of macronutrients (protein, carbohydrate and fat) to achieve a body composition goal.


    Macronutrients or Macros make up the majority of our diets. There are three main macronutrients: Protein, Fat and Carbohydrate.


    • 1 gram of Protein = 4 Calories
    • 1 gram of Carbohydrate = 4 Calories
    • 1 gram of Fat = 9 Calories

    Rather then typical calorie counting(eg. Eating 2000 calories a day), Flexible Dieters would track macronutrient intake(eg. Eating 150g Protein, 170g Carbohydrate, 80g Fat = 2000 calories), which more effectively influences body composition rahter than just weight loss or gain.


    Flexible Dieting follows the belief that there are no miracle weight loss foods. No good or bad foods, just macro ratios.
